edu.cnm.deepdive.util

Class DateOnly

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.util.DateOnly

  • public class DateOnly
extends Object
    This class contains a stub of the elapsedDays(int, int, int) method. Implementation of this method is included in the practical exam problems of the Deep Dive Coding Java + Android Bootcamp.

    For extra credit, values of the month and day parameters outside the "natural" ranges must be allowed, with such values normalized automatically. For example, a month value of 12 would be treated as month 0 (the first month) of the following year; a day value of 0 would be treated as the last day of the previous month; etc.

    Author:
    Nicholas Bennett, Deep Dive Coding

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int elapsedDays(int year, int month, int day)
      Computes and returns the number of days between January 1, 1970 and the specified date.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • elapsedDays

        public static int elapsedDays(int year,
                              int month,
                              int day)
        Computes and returns the number of days between January 1, 1970 and the specified date. The ISO 8601 calendar is assumed, and dates prior to 1583 (and even prior to 1 BCE) are supported.
        Parameters:
        year - ISO 8601 calendar year.
        month - 0-based month number (0=January, 1=February, etc.).
        day - 1-based day of month.
        Returns:
        difference in days between specified date and January 1, 1970. If the specified date is before January 1, 1970, a negative value is returned.
